## Research question

- Does the ETFs affect price discovery? 

## Market Design

- 3 assets: A, B and C, where $C= A + B$
- T = 15 periods
- dividend streams: 
  - A pays 1 or -1 
  - B pays the opposite of A in all periods. Starting from t=8, pays plus 1. 
- $FV_{{A,t}}= 10$
- $FV_{B,t}=\left\{\begin{array}{ll} 18 & \mbox{for}\ t \leq 8 \\
            (T-t+1)10 + 10 & \mbox{for}\ t > 8
            \end{array} \right.$
- $FV_{C,t}=\left\{\begin{array}{ll} 28 & \mbox{for}\ t \leq 8 \\
            (T-t+1)10 + 20 & \mbox{for}\ t > 8
            \end{array} \right.$

## Experimental Design

- Each session, 9 players, 2 big markets
- One market is randomly paid 
- In a big market, we have 3 Call Markets (one market per asset)
- Endowments of (A, B, C,cash) according to type

```{r echo=FALSE, results= 'asis'}
e_1<-c(8,2,0,444)
e_2<-c(2,8,0,396)
e_3<-c(0,0,10,280)
table_endowments<-rbind(e_1,e_2,e_3)
colnames(table_endowments)<-c("A","B","C","cash")
rownames(table_endowments)<-c("type I","type II", "type III")

library(knitr)
kable(table_endowments,caption="Endowments")
```
